basic_info.name: Andhra University College of Engineering FAQs

faqs.question: Can I apply for Andhra University even though my graduation results are still awaited?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, applications can be made for the Entrance Test. On clearing which, a ‘provisional’ admission shall be allowed but the admission will only be confirmed when the mark sheet with eligible aggregate will be produced to the University.

faqs.question: Is counseling done prior to admission at Andhra University?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, counseling is offered to students prior to admission. Attending the counseling is mandatory and any student failing to attend will not be considered for admission.

faqs.question: Is the appearance for entrance exams necessary for Andhra University?
faqs.answer: Ans.The admission to the courses is considered on the basis of the merit of the entrance exams. The students who fail to appear for the entrance exams are not eligible for admission.

faqs.question: Are the Andhra University courses full-time?
faqs.answer: Ans.Yes, the courses are full time and attendance is mandatory. The students are not allowed to register for any other courses and actions will be taken if found guilty.

faqs.question: Can students from Humanities background in 10+2 apply for UG courses?
faqs.answer: Ans.The UG courses at AUCE (A) require a minimum of 50% in 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. The students who did not have the above-mentioned subjects in their 10+2 are not eligible for the courses.

faqs.question: How is the AUCE Faculty?
faqs.answer: Ans.Andhra University College of Engineering faculty has a total of 180 faculty members consisting of Chairman, Assistant Professors, and Professors.Read More:Andhra University College of Engineering Faculty

Section.name: About AUCE
Section.description:
Andhra University College of Engineering (AUCE) was established in 1946 in the Composite Madras State. Later, in 1955, it shifted to the North Campus of the Andhra University in Visakhapatnam. The college has been ranked at #94 by NIRF. The college offers 17 UG and 35 PG courses along with the Research courses such as BE, B.Tech and B.Arch at UG level and ME, M.Tech, MCA, M.Sc., and M.Planning at PG level. The admission to the university is done on the basis of the entrance exam. The application process for these courses is online.
4.1 How to apply?
